meanings.definition: To bring under collective control or ownership.
meanings.sent1: The community collectivised the land for everyone to share.
meanings.sent2: The farmers collectivised their resources to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The ants collectivised their food storage, ensuring no crumbs were wasted.
meanings.sent4: The students collectivised their study notes, creating a comprehensive guide.
meanings.sent5: The team collectivised their efforts, achieving success through collaboration.

meanings.sent1: The neighborhood collectivised a clean-up day to improve the environment.
meanings.sent2: The workers collectivised their tasks to streamline the production process.
meanings.sent3: The birds collectivised their chirping, creating a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent4: The orchestra collectivised their instruments, producing a symphony of sound.
meanings.sent5: The family collectivised their chores, making household responsibilities easier to manage.
